title: Formal languages and automata
description:
Course Content: 
The course will cover the following topics: 
1. Mathematical models of data, computational problems, and computational processes.
2. Turing machines and decidable languages.
3. Techniques for proving undecidability of computational problems: diagonalization and 
reductions.
4. Godel's incompleteness theorems.
5. Resource-bounded Turing machines and computationally hard problems. Polynomial-time 
reductions. Classes P and NP.
